channel.title: Photography help
channel.description: i don't know what section it belongs to but i got this negative for school assignment all developed i have to make the back ground of it become blur and the object in front normal as it is can you help plz and thank you

item.title: Photography help
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

same lol still using the deal old japan SRL still its some what good quality

Read full topic

item.title: Photography help
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

SETO:

i mean my teacher told me using eraser on the non chemical side of the negative i can some what get the background to blur i mean the place i touched up with the eraser. i can do it on photo shop but it needs to be done on the negative

Wow that’s actually a good idea. I never thought of that, thanks. I’m also in photography. I don’t know why we are using old SLR camera’s, would make more sense with digital slr’s…

Read full topic

item.title: Photography help
item.dc:creator: @kurt pixels
item.description:
@kurt wrote:

SETO:

i don’t know what section it belongs to but i got this negative for school assignment all developed i have to make the back ground of it become blur and the object in front normal as it is can you help plz and thank you

If you are doing this with a 35 Millimeter camera…

Set shutter seconds to like 4 or 5

Take a picture of a stopsign, and then some cars going through it…

AND that is a fast way.

Read full topic

item.title: Photography help
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

I get what hes saying. I could do it for you, just scan and post the image and I’ll give it back to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Photography help
item.dc:creator: @Got_Shine Got_Shine
item.description:
@Got_Shine wrote:

If you give a picture to me, I’ll do it in photoshop, this should probably be in gfx but it doesn’t really matter.

Just tell me what you want focused, and I’ll blur the rest.

Edit: after jme’s response i’m confused. Do you want to know how to blur the negative itself, or do you just want an image blurred?

Read full topic

item.title: Photography help
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Wait, you can make the background blury after it has been developed? Your confusing me with your question, but if you want the background blurt then you would use a low aperture, such as f/2

Read full topic
